website_summaries.verdict: Offers a nice price per foot of coverage area, as this is a large roll. Has a little bit of flexibility for rough bark trees.
pros: Gives you a coverage area of 150 feet by 4 inches, so it handles even large trees nicely
Crepe design stretches a bit to cover oddly shaped trees and rough bark
Yields a nice level of protection against harsh weather and stray trimmer string
cons: Doesn't seem to hold up well after a heavy rain hits it

customer_reviews.title: This item is NOT as described!
customer_reviews.text: This item is NOT as described--it is NOT asphalt-impregnated. It is priced at the rate for the asphalt wrap, but is the standard double layer wrap. I talked to the owner of the company which produced it and he said the asphalt tape does not have the green writing on it. It simply has a sticker with the UPC code. This product should be priced at about $15 per roll. He said the retail for the asphalt-impregnated wrap is about $21 (plus shipping). Bottom line--this is NOT as described, and far overpriced for what it is. It is an excellent tree wrap, but if you need the insect and rodent protection provided by asphalt, this is NOT for you.
customer_reviews.author: thebeekeeper1

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect asphalt in tape!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this item I first read the reviews and took special note of one in particular that cautioned that the product advertised was not the one that is shipped. I was especially concerned about the description that claimed a thin layer of asphalt was part of the tape's construction since that is what I wanted to further deter small rodent damage. I've had great success with that type for years. I thought surely by now the description would have either changed or the shipping error corrected. WRONG. My tape does not contain the asphalt as advertised, but due to time constraints I am forced to use what was sent.
customer_reviews.author: Deepwoods

customer_reviews.title: Description STILL incorrect (5 1/2 years! from first review noting this)!  No asphalt!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that Amazon had updated the description but they have not. There is NO ASPHALT in this product in spite of the description. I'm checking other online sources as have had great success with the asphalt version in the past. Disappointing!!! This makes this wrap very flimsy and it tears easily (especially when wet). Stay away until Amazon gets the kind with the tar on it (which is what is described here).
customer_reviews.author: MGoBlueBob

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have six new trees in the yard I had to wrap for the Colorado winter. I admit when I first saw the tree wrap I had a small pang of "I paid how much for this?" but once I had it opened and got my hands on it I realized it's actually a very nice product. It's light in hand which belies the sturdiness, I wasn't overly gentle with my wrapping and had no mishaps or tears, it's tough! I have everything wrapped now and will update this review if I find any anomalies in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reader

customer_reviews.title: Best Available
customer_reviews.text: This is the only tree wrap that I use. I tried others, but they fall apart. This doesn't. It stays in place and protects trees from rodents in the winter and sun scald in the summer. Even better, it comes in 150 foot rolls so goes a very long way. It's easy to wrap, and because of the color, it looks just like the tree trunk. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to protects his trees.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product - multiple re-wraps required
customer_reviews.text: I've had to re-wrap trees multiple times with this product! I've used Clark tree wrap the last several years. Each year, it has had the green logo/writing on it. This year when I received it, it was plain on both sides. I don't know if they changed their design or if I received a knockoff but this version is terrible. I've never had trees lose their wrapping like this one. Disappointing and will not be ordering again. Having gone through the tree wrap exercise for several years, I know it isn't operator error, it is product failure.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Yup it's tree wrap, what I like is it looks good and will allow tree trunk to breath while protecting against excessive sunlight. My use is mainly for young fruit trees which is easily damaged by sun. I use ProThec Green three wire tie to secure to tie off the loose end of the wrap. There are plenty of other options. I like that the tree can grow and the worst leftover is cardboard mulch.
customer_reviews.author: Dingo

customer_reviews.title: Love the concept, but needs more colors
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint would be I wish there were other colors. It looks weird on a dark hemlock or cherry tree. But on the other hand, it looks more natural. I just installed 2 rolls in July, 2015, and will update my review. I had ugly plastic on my trees to keep woodpecker's from having dinner on my trees. I totally approve of the concept and with Prime delivery it was a no brain er. I only gave it 3 stars b/c winter's in upstate NY can be brutal. My gardener also thought this was easily installed. He topped it off with a stapler. -David Allen.
customer_reviews.author: David Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great tree wrap, good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to wrap your tree trunks. I have two 30 foot Sugar Maples in my front yard that were sun scorched last winter. I wrapped one this afternoon and it goes on smooth and conforms to the trunk perfectly. It also looks nice. Be sure and get the 150 foot roll for the best price. The 4 inch width is also perfect to make the wrap look nice. I'll order another roll soon just to keep plenty on hand! I've used this product in the past and know that it will easily last the season with all the rain and snow. Glad I found it!
customer_reviews.author: Fleur

customer_reviews.title: works so much better and stays up
customer_reviews.text: falls off after gets wet. Tried on small tree and large tree, twice. Bought burlap roll instead with flower wire, works so much better and stays up.
customer_reviews.author: Kellyn Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Multi use Wrap
customer_reviews.text: Use this wrap to protect tree trunks from deer. Also have used it as a band around trees and applied Tanglefoot for gypsy moth caterpillars. In both cases it has done the job without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: tumbleweed

customer_reviews.title: Item not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Item they send you is not the same as described it is 1 layer with no asphalt in product. Will be returning and purchasing Leonard Crinkled Paper Tree Wrap, 150 Foot Roll as is does have asphalt, nessary for rodent protection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Protect young trees in the winter and early spring
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on a web site. How to protect your young tree trunks from getting frostbite and sun burned during the winter time and early spring. I was skeptical at first. But I have to admit it really does work.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has wrapped several of our trees that were being picked on by the deer. We lost a couple and then we got the tree wrap from you, put it on, and now the deer and other animals are leaving our trees alone and the trees that had lost their bark previously, seem to be making a slight comeback. We are very pleased with this tree wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hunsinger

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I wrapped it tight and in the first hard rain, it separated. It didn't fall off but was worthless for protection. I would expect over a season for it to wear out, but this was in the first week. It is paper and I guess stretched in the rain and lost its tight wrap. I guess you will be OK if there is no rain in your area.
customer_reviews.author: Drugdoc

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: We were surprised that we had enough (and extra!) to wrap 6 apple trees we just plated this year!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Grajczyk

customer_reviews.title: GYPSY MOTHS BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: The tree wrap is good quality paper and will do the trick. I didn't read the description well enough and assumed it would have a sticky side to capture. Gypsy Moth catepillars and it doesn't ... So I purchased a container of Tanglefoot to apply to the strip.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Guiseclowes

customer_reviews.title: Ok wrap.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive wrap. Only lasted one winter use. I usually get a couple of winters out of this type of wrap. Best to buy this product when it is at a reduced/sale price.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product, had splitting on the trunks of several ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, had splitting on the trunks of several young trees, researched what to do and this product was recommended, looks like it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E.

customer_reviews.title: ... trees and dressing the wounds the tree wrap works great in keeping out the
customer_reviews.text: After trimming the trees and dressing the wounds the tree wrap works great in keeping out the insects
customer_reviews.author: Miles Long

customer_reviews.title: Great product, we use it every winter
customer_reviews.text: Great product, we use it every winter, gentle on the trees and the color blends in. Will continue to use it. The 4" is the best size for 2 to 4" trees.
customer_reviews.author: MileHi

customer_reviews.title: Winter care
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time and so far working great, easy to apply. just needed some tape to finish it off at the top. Of course we will have to wait until the Spring to see if it truly worked, but compared to other products I have seen it looks like a good bet.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Tree Wrap worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Home stores sell cheaper brands and have tried them, just don't hold up. Used this last two winters works great and last well till spring. Spend a couple extra dollars on these you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: JPFLYONE

customer_reviews.title: Best Tree Wrap Money Can Buy
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing. Beats all the other junk on the market. Really durable and form-fits the tree almost as if it's an elastic bandage. Tough but flexible. Pay a bit more and buy this wrap rather than going cheaper and wasting your hard-earned money.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch
customer_reviews.text: I was not sent Clark's tree wrap but a cheaper brand not impregnated with asphalt. Rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Plethodon

customer_reviews.title: Fruit Tree Protection
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the critters from chewing my apple trees every winter. Only problem I ever have is how to keep it tight at the top so it doesn't call down. I use duct tape.
customer_reviews.author: MI Mud Puppy

customer_reviews.title: Good Rap, keep young trees bark warm in winter
customer_reviews.text: Good Rap,keep young trees bark warm in winter.also keeps the bunnies away from my trees.
customer_reviews.author: Sidena  Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Work Well
customer_reviews.text: Initially it seems like this wrapping is too thin but you can't judge a book by its cover. On our half acre, we have planted numerous types of trees. We lost the bananana trees last year because we DIDN'T wrap them. This year, we wrapped about 15 trees, including the banana trees, and they are all doing just fine. And this wrap is easy to apply, hold in place, and reusable!
customer_reviews.author: J. Medearis

customer_reviews.title: pretty when secured
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking wrap, hard to keep in place. Tends to blow loose in heavy winds and needs to be secured well. A good combo to use along with an elastic wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very good wrap. Very easy to use. Good and strong. Used to wrap my small fruit so the rabbits do not eat the bark off of them this winter.
customer_reviews.author: True Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tree Wrap
customer_reviews.text: This really is an inexpensive effective tree wrap. We were pleased with how it worked. We used straight pins to pin the wrap to itself and it is working great. We have high winds and deep snow in Montana and the wrap is staying on the trees and effectively protecting them from sun and snow burn.
customer_reviews.author: balldt

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what this stuff is supposed to do, but it doesn't do anything for me. It weathers poorly and falls off in less than a season.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to protect trees.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to stop sun scald on newly planted trees. It is easy to put on (just used duct tape) and it stays on to protect the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Wrap Your Little Trees!
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should, time will tell me more, but wrapped all my young peach trees with it...25 in all.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy picture

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hard to keep on tree needs some kind of adhesive
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Giasone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height
customer_reviews.text: The 4 inch roll worked out perfectly. I needed something to raise my pot of geraniums a little higher so they would show out my front window. Four inches was the perfect amount to raise the pot so the roll of tree wrap was perfect. A little unconventional, but it worked fine. I recommend this product for anyone with similar needs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N. Sparbel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. Don't know what I would do without it now !!!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it will do the trick
customer_reviews.text: I have about 20 maple trees that the bark split last winter and really affected the growth of them this year. I think the wrap will do the trick. I would have given the item five stars, but it hasn't stayed put like I thought it would. I have taped the top and bottom of the tree wrap, but the wrap slides a little, like a worn tube sock. I think it will still work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Milt Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Much better than the white plastic corrugated ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Much better than the white plastic corrugated trunk covers that can harbor earwigs and other insects who like the moist darkness and eat the bark.
customer_reviews.author: mary knotts

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this purchase. I used long straight pins at the top to hold it tight. Very easy to do and have enough to wrap many more times if it doesn't hold up over winter.
customer_reviews.author: RLW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Much less expensive than local stores - easy to use and a nice, natural look.
customer_reviews.author: rog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works far better than paint. Can't tell its there from 10 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: William Pohl

customer_reviews.title: Effective product at value price
customer_reviews.text: Will be using this with Tanglefoot Tree Pest Barrier as part of a treatment to capture female canker moths as they try to migrate from the ground up to the tops of my 2 beautiful Oak trees. In the Spring the caterpillars which hatch from the female eggs, completely defoliate and weaken many oak trees in our city. This procedure is a measure successfully used by many residents here to help control canker worm invasion.
customer_reviews.author: John Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great! Just what my little trees need for the winter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for protecting tree trunks in the short run or when a plastic guard is not in the budget.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tree Wrap
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't get any better than this if you want to protect your trees from the sun and other elements.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Moreau

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good durable wrap with enough on roll to do numerous trees.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. So far the cats are not tearing it to get to the tree.
customer_reviews.author: c Marshfield mo..

customer_reviews.title: misleading
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely not what was described as burlap. This was very thin corraguated carboard. A big waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Tina Holt

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!
customer_reviews.text: Wrapped 2 trees in our backyard and within 1 week it began to shift and expose the trunk. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: This is for bigger treas than is shown here
customer_reviews.text: The width is too great for anything but larger trees, like 8" or larger. So while it works it is not as easily tied on as I would like, but the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: sltuttle

customer_reviews.title: great product, easy to use and wrap
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, great product. Wraps easily and is super durable, tucking it at the bottom was a breeze and it stays put druring our wild MT winters
customer_reviews.author: hidjmt

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back
customer_reviews.text: This was like cardboard so I didn't use it. It was for chair decorations for a wedding but shipping was great and return was ok but I didn't get a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: tracy

customer_reviews.title: Better to use a sleeve type of product
customer_reviews.text: Even with duct tape it unravels and hangs loose off the tree. Better to use a sleeve type of product.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: attracted termites to my trees
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. I wrapped these on my trees and they attracted termites. I didn't notice for a while so it was past the return period ... so I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M. Till

customer_reviews.title: Tree Wrap for Bark Protection
customer_reviews.text: If it has good results we may rate it higher, but it is too early to tell. Hopefully, it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Schindler

product_meta.title: Walter E Clark 4-Inch by 150-Foot Tree Wrap 00304
product_meta.description: Size:1-(Pack)Helps To Protect Trees From: Sunscald, Severe frost, Rodents, Windburn Lawn trimmers. Preserves moisture content of bark. Prevents excessive dripping.
feature_bullets: Tree wrap give landscape projects an attractive, neat look while providing protection from sun scald, windburn, severe frost and law trimmers
Tree wrap helps to preserve the moisture content of the bark
Made of two 30-pound layers of high quality kraft paper laminated with 25-pound layer of asphalt
Creped to provide approximately 25-30 percent stretch to conform to irregular surfaces
Measures 4-inches in width by 150-foot long; easy to apply by simply wrapping around the tree and securing with either tape or staples

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
